lead_paragraph: Rodents, the traditional scourge of New York City, are having a rough year. The rise of the bedbug seems to have rendered rats a has-been pest, a mere nuisance to be ignored rather than read about in countless alarmist trend articles. The bedbug is a breakout media star; the rat is, well, still a rat.
snippet: Off the Rails: Nearly 90 percent of people who responded to a survey sponsored by State Senator Bill Perkins said they saw rats on a daily or weekly basis.

headline.main: Northern Manhattan Subway Riders Say Rats Abound

abstract: Off the Rails: Nearly 90 percent of people who responded to a survey sponsored by State Senator Bill Perkins said they saw rats on a daily or weekly basis.
